intro: Sinapis juncea, commonly known as field mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and broccoli. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring alternate, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its seeds are small, spherical, and often used as a spice in various cuisines. Field mustard is also valued for its nutritional content and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
